Articles.Content:
... feeling like I am playing it wrong

BUT! Because I am not playing KSP for the math but because of the explosions I am fine with that

Anyways, her Stream is really really helpfull and it is good to see how other people are playing.

Gives you some fresh ideas

Keep it going Tanuki.
i do not playing with math. i test all the stuff out and remember what i need and it work.
It is not exactly math what she does, be she is so overwhelming aware of how much fuel she is taking with her and how much weight her craft has. I am totally stunned

Oh, it's math alright. Merely because she doesn't do complicated equations to work everything out doesn't mean she hasn't got a very good idea of what's going on in her head. She's got a pretty good grasp of the concepts required... and that's neat, because it's a much more adaptable approach than raw math.
Yeah, the concepts are the point as I am not playing with any concept at all

... feeling like I am playing it wrong

BUT! Because I am not playing KSP for the math but because of the explosions I am fine with that

Anyways, her Stream is really really helpfull and it is good to see how other people are playing.

Gives you some fresh ideas

Keep it going Tanuki.

Roger Wilco
Hello there. I just wanted to say how flattered I am. Thank you very much

Isnt it amazing how you learn every day a little bit more about Orbital Mechanics?

A Year ago i thought... yeah when you want to go to the moon .. it is right there so go straight way up.

Today I am learning how to circularize (a word I havent known before playing ksp) your orbit around a gasgiant by doing a reverse gravity assist on its heaviest moon (which I havent thought of before).

...

Today I am learning how to circularize (a word I havent known before playing ksp) your orbit around a gasgiant ...

Circularize? I haven't known this word before now. I sounds like it could be related to orbits, though!

It sure is fun but I doubt the skills we are learning will make us qualified to work for NASA anytime soon! I doubt aerobraking into a gas giant has any real-life potential. Correct me if I'm wrong.

I still think it is food for our brains though.

Circularize? I haven't known this word before now. I sounds like it could be related to orbits, though!

It sure is fun but I doubt the skills we are learning will make us qualified to work for NASA anytime soon! I doubt aerobraking into a gas giant has any real-life potential. Correct me if I'm wrong.

I still think it is food for our brains though.

Circularizing means that you adjust your apoapsis/periapsis to be almost the same,and thus,make your orbit more circular.

Circularizing means that you adjust your apoapsis/periapsis to be almost the same,and thus,make your orbit more circular.

I thought it meant promoting your orbit in circulars so everyone knows how great it is
